meanings.definition: Relating to the science of surveying and charting bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrographic team used advanced tools to map the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The hydrographic survey revealed new details about the lake's depth.
meanings.sent3: The hydrographic experts made waves with their precise underwater maps.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hydrographic instrument, navigating the sea of information.
meanings.sent5: The hydrographic data painted a clear picture of the river's topography.

meanings.definition: A map or chart showing the physical features of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrographic displayed the intricate details of the bay's coastline.
meanings.sent2: I studied the hydrographic to plan our sailing route.
meanings.sent3: The hydrographic seemed to whisper secrets of the underwater world.
meanings.sent4: His eyes scanned the hydrographic, tracing the river's twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The hydrographic was a colorful masterpiece of the lake's depths.

meanings.definition: The process of measuring and describing the physical features of bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrographic involved using specialized equipment to map the sea floor.
meanings.sent2: We learned about hydrographic during our marine science class.
meanings.sent3: The hydrographic turned the dull task of mapping into an exciting adventure.
meanings.sent4: She approached the hydrographic with precision, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The hydrographic expedition uncovered hidden treasures beneath the waves.
